briefdescription.para: get list of available time zone region
returns tz_info (helper for boost python really)
construct a timezone with standard offset, no dst, name= UTC+01 etc.
construct a timezone from tz_info shared ptr provided from typically time_zone db
construct a timezone based on region id uses internal tz_info_database to lookup the name.
construct utctime from calendar coordinates YMDhms

detaileddescription.para: If the YMDhms is invalid, runtime_error is thrown. Currently just trivial checks is done.

parameterdescription.para: YMDhms that has to be valid calendar coordinates.

simplesect.para: special values of YMDhms, like max,min,null is mapped to corresponding utctime concepts.

memberdef.argsstring: (int Y, int M=1, int D=1, int h=0, int m=0, int s=0) const
memberdef.name: time

briefdescription.para: return the calendar units of t taking timezone and dst into account

detaileddescription.para:
Special utctime values, no_utctime max_utctime, min_utctime are mapped to corresponding YMDhms special values.
YMDhms
calendar units YMDhmsreturns 0=sunday, 1= monday ... 6=sat.

briefdescription.para: returns the month of t, 1..12, -1 of not valid time
returns a readable iso standard string
returns a readable period with time as for calendar::to_string
round down (floor) to nearest utctime with deltaT resolution.

detaileddescription.para:
If delta T is calendar::DAY,WEEK,MONTH,YEAR it do a time-zone semantically correct rounding. if delta T is any other number, e.g. minute/hour, the result is similar to integer truncation at the level of delta T.
t
utctime to be trimmed
deltaT
utctimespan specifying the resolution, use calendar::DAY,WEEK,MONTH,YEAR specify calendar specific resolutions
a trimmed utctime

memberdef.argsstring: (utctime t, utctimespan deltaT, long n) const
memberdef.name: add

detaileddescription.para: conceptually this is similar to t + deltaT*n but with deltaT equal to calendar::DAY,WEEK,MONTH,YEAR and/or with dst enabled time-zone the variation of length due to dst or month/year length is taken into account e.g. add one day, and calendar have dst, could give 23,24 or 25 hours due to dst. similar for week or any other time steps.

simplesect.para:
DST -if the calendar include dst, following rules applies:
transition hour 1st hour after dst has changed
if t and resulting t have different utc-offsets, the result is adjusted dst adjustment with the difference.

parameterdescription.para: utctime to add n deltaT from
that can be any, but with calendar::DAY,WEEK,MONTH,YEAR calendar semantics applies
number of delta T to add, can be negative

memberdef.argsstring: (utctime t1, utctime t2, utctimespan deltaT, utctimespan &remainder) const
memberdef.name: diff_units

briefdescription.para: calculate the distance t1..t2 in specified units

detaileddescription.para: The function takes calendar semantics when deltaT is calendar::DAY,WEEK,MONTH,YEAR, and in addition also dst. e.g. the diff_units of calendar::DAY over summer->winter shift is 1, remainder is 0, even if the number of hours during those days are 23 and 25 summer and winter transition respectively

simplesect.para: (t2-t1)/deltaT, and remainder, where deltaT could be calendar units DAY,WEEK,MONTH,YEARdiff_units discarding remainder,

memberdef.argsstring: (utctime t1, utctime t2, utctimespan deltaT) const
memberdef.name: diff_units

briefdescription.para: Calendar deals with the concept of human calendar.

detaileddescription.para: Please notice that although the calendar concept is complete, we only implement features as needed in the core and interfaces.

including:
Conversion between the calendar coordinates YMDhms and utctime, taking any timezone and DST into account
Calendar constants, utctimespan like values for Year,Month,Week,Day,Hour,Minute,Second
Calendar arithmetic, like adding calendar units, e.g. day,month,year etc.
Calendar arithmetic, like trim/truncate a utctime down to nearest timespan/calendar unit. eg. day
Calendar arithmetic, like calculate difference in calendar units(e.g days) between two utctime points
Calendar Timezone and DST handling
Converting utctime to string and vice-versa
